rationale: The segment reports the number of human infections, deaths, and critically ill cases without using intensifiers or comparatives modifying risk adjectives.
statement_text: China has reported 21 human infections with the H5N6 subtype of avian influenza in 2021 to the World Health Organization, compared with only five last year, it [China] said, with six dead and many of the others critically ill.

rationale: The segment uses neutral verbs and reports factual outcomes (dead, critically ill) neutrally.
statement_text: China has reported 21 human infections with the H5N6 subtype of avian influenza in 2021 to the World Health Organization, compared with only five last year, it [China] said, with six dead and many of the others critically ill.

rationale: The segment reports outcomes ('infections', 'dead', 'critically ill') paired with scale, but lacks a moderate verb describing impact.

rationale: The segment does not contain a loaded rhetorical question.
